data:
Hi there,
As you are a year ahead of me, could I get a little help finding housing for me for this next Fall term at OSU? I tried looking at Craigslist, but I can’t tell what’s good and what’s not!
I’m on a budget, so let’s keep it under $700 a month. And no roommate! If you can, find a place that doesn’t accept cats or dogs. Please send me links to the best place or two that you find!
Thank you ever so much, 
Myrcella

Hi Myrcella,

 

It’s a bit late to be finding a place for Fall Term. http://corvallis.craigslist.org/apa/5738704418.html seems like your best bet. It’s a studio, but it’s cheap and pet-free. 

 

http://corvallis.craigslist.org/apa/5772867666.html looks like a significantly better living situation, but you can’t move in until October 8th. 

 

Sorry I couldn’t be more help. Let me know if you need anything else!

 

Charles Chatsworth

 

From: Baratheon, Myrcella 
Sent: Tuesday, September 13, 2016 1:04 PM
To: Chatsworth, Charles <Charles.Chatsworth@oregonstate.edu>
Subject:  Housing... OMG!

 

Hi there,
As you are a year ahead of me, could I get a little help finding housing for me for this next Fall term at OSU? I tried looking at Craigslist, but I can’t tell what’s good and what’s not!
I’m on a budget, so let’s keep it under $700 a month. And no roommate! If you can, find a place that doesn’t accept cats or dogs. Please send me links to the best place or two that you find!
Thank you ever so much, 
Myrcella

Thanks, Charles! Saving money and finding a place right away are definitely important!

 

Myr

 

From: Chatsworth, Charles 
Sent: Tuesday, September 13, 2016 1:11 PM
To: Baratheon, Myrcella <Myrcella.Baratheon@oregonstate.edu>
Subject: RE:  Housing... OMG!

 

Hi Myrcella,

 

It’s a bit late to be finding a place for Fall Term. http://corvallis.craigslist.org/apa/5738704418.html seems like your best bet. It’s a studio, but it’s cheap and pet-free. 

 

http://corvallis.craigslist.org/apa/5772867666.html looks like a significantly better living situation, but you can’t move in until October 8th. 

 

Sorry I couldn’t be more help. Let me know if you need anything else!

 

Charles Chatsworth

Subject:  Housing... OMG!

As you are a year ahead of me, could I get a little help finding housing for me for this next Fall term at OSU? I tried looking at Craigslist, but I can’t tell what’s good and what’s not!
I’m on a budget, so let’s keep it under $700 a month. And no roommate! If you can, find a place that doesn’t accept cats or dogs. Please send me links to the best place or two that you find!
Thank you ever so much,

Hi!

 

There’s a picnic in the woods near Alsea that we’re supposed to go to this weekend. We may also hike to the waterfall. Can you please check the weather and let me know what I should wear and if I should bring sunscreen?

 

Thank you, 

 

Myrcella

Myrcella,

 

What bad luck! The weather in Alsea is beautiful until the weekend. It gets cloudy on Saturday and rainy on Saturday. Skip the sunscreen and pack rain gear instead. It doesn’t need to be heavy rain gear – it’s still supposed to be relatively warm.

 

Charles Chatsworth

 

From: Baratheon, Myrcella 
Sent: Tuesday, September 13, 2016 1:12 PM
To: Chatsworth, Charles <Charles.Chatsworth@oregonstate.edu>
Subject:  Weather?

 

 

Hi!

 

There’s a picnic in the woods near Alsea that we’re supposed to go to this weekend. We may also hike to the waterfall. Can you please check the weather and let me know what I should wear and if I should bring sunscreen?

 

Thank you, 

 

Myrcella

Thank you so much, Charles. I find it so depressing to check the weather myself. I guess it will really rain if you see it too! The hike should be fun, though!

 

Myr

Sent: Tuesday, September 13, 2016 1:14 PM
To: Baratheon, Myrcella <Myrcella.Baratheon@oregonstate.edu>
Subject: RE:  Weather?

Myrcella

Hello Charles,

 

I am planning an event at my sorority this weekend and I could use some ideas for food to make as appetizers. I am expecting to have 20 people at the event and would like to include options for those who are vegetarian or gluten free. I will have about an hour to make these ahead of time so please keep that in mind as you research. It’s really important that people love the event, so try and pick some recipes that people will rave about!

 

Please email me three or four recipes that I can consider for appetizers.  

 

Thank you, 

 

Myrcella

These look good.

 

http://allrecipes.com/recipe/15184/mouth-watering-stuffed-mushrooms/?internalSource=hn_carousel%2001_Mouth-Watering%20Stuffed%20Mushrooms&referringId=263&referringContentType=recipe%20hub&referringPosition=carousel%2001

http://allrecipes.com/recipe/14830/hummus-iii/?internalSource=staff%20pick&referringId=263&referringContentType=recipe%20hub&clickId=cardslot%202

http://allrecipes.com/recipe/15031/veggie-delight-on-garlic-bread/?internalSource=staff%20pick&referringId=263&referringContentType=recipe%20hub&clickId=cardslot%205

 

All are vegetarian, and only the last one has gluten. I’m particularly a fan of the Stuffed Mushrooms. My dear mother used to make them.

 

Charles Chatsworth

 

From: Baratheon, Myrcella 
Sent: Tuesday, September 13, 2016 1:16 PM
To: Chatsworth, Charles <Charles.Chatsworth@oregonstate.edu>
Subject:  Awesome recipes

 

 

Hello Charles,

 

I am planning an event at my sorority this weekend and I could use some ideas for food to make as appetizers. I am expecting to have 20 people at the event and would like to include options for those who are vegetarian or gluten free. I will have about an hour to make these ahead of time so please keep that in mind as you research. It’s really important that people love the event, so try and pick some recipes that people will rave about!

 

Please email me three or four recipes that I can consider for appetizers.  

 

Thank you, 

 

Myrcella

These are great, Charles. All of them have a certain, “mass appeal”. My sisters should love it.

 

Myr

Hello Charles,

 

Just a friendly reminder that I’ll need the following two books soon and you promised to help me buy them for a good price! :)

 

Please find them wherever you can, just make sure you will receive them by next week for classes. My budget is at most 200 dollars to get these two textbooks, but please please please try and find the best available prices.

 

Textbooks Needed:

Engineering Economic Analysis by Donald Newnan 12th edition IBSN: 978-0199339273

 

Robert Love, Linux Kernel Development 3/e, Addison-Wesley, 2010, ISBN: 978-1-672-32946-3

 

Email me back with where to buy them for the best price so they’ll arrive next week! I owe you lunch for this big help!

 

Thanks! :) :) :)

Myrcella

I find that Amazon is your best bet if you don’t know anyone personally who might let you borrow the books. Have you checked around first?

 

https://www.amazon.com/ENGR-ECONOMIC-ANALYSIS-STUDY-GUIDE-Donald-Newnan/dp/0199339341/ref=mt_paperback?_encoding=UTF8&me= I found a seller here listing Engineering Economic Analysis for 30 dollars. Unfortunately, the seller has a reputation for not shipping on time. It’s likely that the reports were rare instances, but if you’re feeling worried about that, you should rent the book instead from the same link. It’s 20 dollars more, but the shipping is fulfilled by Amazon which implies a much higher reliability.

 

https://www.amazon.com/Linux-Kernel-Development-Robert-Love/dp/0672329468/ref=sr_1_1?s=books&ie=UTF8&qid=1473798267&sr=1-1&keywords=linux+kernel+development+3rd+edition The Love book is an old edition, so you should be able to find it cheap. The rental price is nearly the same as the price for a brand new copy of the book, so I would suggest just purchasing it. Then you don’t need to worry about sending it back at the end of the term! Of course, the lower price is available as an option.

 

Charles Chatsworth

 

From: Baratheon, Myrcella 
Sent: Tuesday, September 13, 2016 1:21 PM
To: Chatsworth, Charles <Charles.Chatsworth@oregonstate.edu>
Subject:  Textbook help reminder!

 

Hello Charles,

 

Just a friendly reminder that I’ll need the following two books soon and you promised to help me buy them for a good price! :)

Robert Love, Linux Kernel Development 3/e, Addison-Wesley, 2010, ISBN: 978-1-672-32946-3

 

Email me back with where to buy them for the best price so they’ll arrive next week! I owe you lunch for this big help!

 

Thanks! :) :) :)

Myrcella

Oh, Charles. These books look very long and very dreary. I hope I find the motivation to read them! Thank you for tracking down some good prices.

 

Best,

Myr

Hi, Charles ,

 

Game of Thrones season six is over and I really need something new to watch! I just don’t know what would be good. 

 

I’m a big fan of action dramas such as House of Cards and Homeland (all of which I’ve already seen, unfortunately). 

 

What’s the next best show after these three? I don’t want to be fooled into watching something bad, so please see if the critics agree that the show is really excellent. Some rankings would also help give me confidence the show will be worthwhile.

 

Thank you so much! 


Melisandre

This list looks promising.

 

http://www.metacritic.com/browse/tv/genre/metascore/actionadventure?view=condensed

 

Game of Thrones is rated very highly here! The list is ordered by reviews from critics. All of the top ones seem to have near-universal acclaim.

 

Charles Chatsworth

 

From: Lannister, Melisandre 
Sent: Tuesday, September 13, 2016 1:38 PM
To: Chatsworth, Charles <Charles.Chatsworth@oregonstate.edu>
Subject:  Best TV Show to Watch

Thank you so much! 


Melisandre

The show, “The Hollow Crown” reminds me of times past. Maybe I will try that. Thanks for finding this site.

 

Of course, Game of Thrones is rated highly. It’s the very best in television these days :)

 

Melisandre

Hi there!

 

I need to buy a gift for a friend.

 

My friend loves the outdoors and the color pink.

She’s 22 years old and her birthday is in a week (7 days).

I will need something that will get here on time.

Nothing that will take too long to ship please.

 

I have 30 dollars to spend on my friend.

Please spend as close to that as you can.

 

Please email me the link(s) to the gift(s) you find and include how much they cost.

 

Thank you,

Melisandre

Melisandre,

 

I was going to suggest a Hydro Flask (https://www.amazon.com/Hydro-Flask-Insulated-Stainless-Standard/dp/B01ACATE9K/ref=sr_1_20?s=outdoor-recreation&ie=UTF8&qid=1473800293&sr=1-20&refinements=p_36%3A-3000) which are very popular and high-quality water bottles for outdoorsy types. However, for the Hydro Flask products that come in pink (“Pinkadelic” is what they call it) the pink version costs more! What’s up with that?

 

This running armband might work well instead if you’re committed to something pink: https://www.amazon.com/dp/B00V3W3WFY/ref=twister_B00SXRXTCS?_encoding=UTF8&psc=1 

 

As an outdoor enthusiast myself, I think either would be very appreciated. I use both products while hiking.

 

Charles Chatsworth

 

From: Lannister, Melisandre 
Sent: Tuesday, September 13, 2016 1:54 PM
To: Chatsworth, Charles <Charles.Chatsworth@oregonstate.edu>
Subject:  Find a Gift for Someone

 

Hi there!

Thank you,

Melisandre

Pinkadelic would be perfect! I’ll spend more for that! :)

 

Melisandre

Hi there,
 
I heard from a friend that you are the one to talk to about this subject.
 
Unfortunately, my friend has to take two strong medications together - Adderall, and Valium. Are there any issues (contraindications) with taking them both together? Is there anything (food, activities, etc.) that he needs to avoid? I just want him to be safe. Please send a list of what you find, along with links to your resources.
 
Thanks for volunteering to check it out!
 
Davos

It appears to be safe, if a little counterproductive, to take them together. They tend to have opposite effects.

 

https://www.drugs.com/drug-interactions/adderall-with-valium-190-1645-862-441.html

https://www.quora.com/What-is-it-like-to-take-valium-and-Adderall-together

 

Your friend should contact a medical professional, of course.

 

Charles Chatsworth

 

From: Davos Stark [mailto:davos.stark@oregonstate.edu] 
Sent: Tuesday, September 13, 2016 3:44 PM
To: Chatsworth, Charles <Charles.Chatsworth@oregonstate.edu>
Subject:  check on medication

 

Hi there,

 

I heard from a friend that you are the one to talk to about this subject.

 

Unfortunately, my friend has to take two strong medications together - Adderall, and Valium. Are there any issues (contraindications) with taking them both together? Is there anything (food, activities, etc.) that he needs to avoid? I just want him to be safe. Please send a list of what you find, along with links to your resources.

 

Thanks for volunteering to check it out!

 

Davos

Chatsworth,

Hm...I guess I won't use these two together after all.

Davos


On 09/13/2016 03:48 PM, Chatsworth, Charles wrote:


	It appears to be safe, if a little counterproductive, to take them together. They tend to have opposite effects.

	 

	https://www.drugs.com/drug-interactions/adderall-with-valium-190-1645-862-441.html

	https://www.quora.com/What-is-it-like-to-take-valium-and-Adderall-together

	 

	Your friend should contact a medical professional, of course.

	 

	Charles Chatsworth

	 

	From: Davos Stark [mailto:davos.stark@oregonstate.edu] 
	Sent: Tuesday, September 13, 2016 3:44 PM
	To: Chatsworth, Charles <Charles.Chatsworth@oregonstate.edu> <mailto:Charles.Chatsworth@oregonstate.edu> 
	Subject:  check on medication

	 

	Hi there,

	 

	I heard from a friend that you are the one to talk to about this subject.

	 

	Unfortunately, my friend has to take two strong medications together - Adderall, and Valium. Are there any issues (contraindications) with taking them both together? Is there anything (food, activities, etc.) that he needs to avoid? I just want him to be safe. Please send a list of what you find, along with links to your resources.

	 

	Thanks for volunteering to check it out!

	 

	Davos

Hello Charles,
 
I know graduating is coming up soon for you. It would be good to do a preliminary job search. Please find at least 1 job and send me an email with the link(s) to the job(s) you applied for. 
 
 
Here is the link for one job search site to get started. 
 
http://www.indeed.com 
 
Job criteria: 
 
You should find a computer engineering job. 
 
Must start after September 2016.
 
For now, just find one or more jobs you believe will work out well. We can talk about them further at our next meeting.

Greetings, traveler,
 
I hear you’re are interested in exploring Eastern Europe with our group. Recently the group is wondering whether or not it is safe to travel right now. We need to do some research and see what we can find out.
 
The plan is to land in Istanbul. Next, we will be traveling to Sofia, the capital of Bulgaria.  After Sofia, the next step is some car travel to Macedonia and then onwards to Albania. Our last stop will be Tirana, in Albania.
 
The group would like to have some information sent to me to start this travel planning out:
 
A quick overview of each country’s political climate - I don’t want anyone getting into trouble and having this turn into some geopolitical affair! Is the country at war with a US ally? Is the country in political turmoil? Is there a US embassy? Is it safe to travel there now?
 
This will be a good start for the travel planning. Please research these items and send the information to me right away.
 
Kind regards,
Davos Stark
Eastern Reaches, an OSU Travel Group

All of the places you’ve listed have embassies.

 

https://tirana.usembassy.gov/

https://istanbul.usconsulate.gov/

https://bulgaria.usembassy.gov/

https://macedonia.usembassy.gov/

 

There was a coup in Turkey recently, with some terrorist attacks following. The US State Department discourages travel to Turkey for the time being. https://turkey.usembassy.gov/sm072315.html

 

I haven’t been able to find any other active problems in the areas you’ve listed. There’s a bit of simmering resentment between Albania and nearby Serbia, but nothing that should prevent a vacation.

 

Charles Chatsworth
